Properties.Tooltip: After including the property, all arguments will be prefixed with [ref]. This is required to run macros on some versions of Word. If the block does not throw an error related to "ref", then do not turn off this property

Properties.Name: ErrorLevel
Properties.Caption: HandlingMode

Properties.Name: ReportLevel
Properties.Caption: MessageLevel
Properties.Tooltip: Select the level of messages to output blocks during operation. Possible settings: "Default" - by default; "Release" - deactivated output; "Debug" - main information output; "Detailed" - detailed information output. If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

Properties.Name: ExcelWorkbookInstance
Properties.Caption: DocumentInstance
Properties.Tooltip: [Instance] Returns an instance of the open Excel document, in which work is currently taking place

Properties.Name: UseCOM
Properties.Caption: UseCOM
Properties.Tooltip: If ticked off, then the work will take place using the installed Excel. Otherwise, without it.

Properties.Name: Visible
Properties.Caption: Visibility
Properties.Tooltip: If the "Use COM" check mark and the "Visibility" check mark are put, then the Excel interface will be displayed on the monitor screen. If the "Use COM" check mark is put, and the "Visibility" check mark is not, then the work will be with Excel physically running in memory, while its box will not be visible on the screen. If the "Use COM" check mark is not put, then the value of the "Visibility" property will not be taken into account.

Properties.Name: TypeValue
Properties.Caption: TypeValue
Properties.Tooltip: The type of value being written. Possible options: Any - recording without conversion; Text - the value is written as text; Number - the value is written as a number; Money - the value is written as a money type (rounded to 2 decimal places); Image - image (the "Value" property specifies the full path to the image on disk)

Properties.Tooltip: [Text] The range of cells from which data should be read (for example, "B4", "A1:C4"). If only the initial cell is specified, the data will be read to the end of the filled rows/columns. The value also takes * by templates (for example, "B4:*", "A1:*4", "A1:E*")

Properties.Name: HasHeaders

Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, the first row of the read range will be the column header of the table

Properties.Name: ConsiderEmpty

Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, then when calculating the number of rows and (or) columns, empty cell values will be taken into account

Properties.Name: ConsiderHidden

Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, then hidden rows or columns will be taken into account when calculating the number of rows and (or) columns

Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Folder name in Outlook. For example: "Inbox". If necessary, specify the subfolders separated by the '\' symbol. For example: "Inbox\TestFolder"

Properties.Name: Count
Properties.Caption: NumberOfEmails
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Number of recently received emails that should be added to the final list

Properties.Caption: Filter
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Filter for receiving emails. The filter format follows the format of the Items.Restrict method (Outlook). Examples can be seen in the expression editor in the "Filters for Outlook" category

Properties.Name: OnlyUnread
Properties.Caption: UnreadOnly
Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, only unread emails will be received

Properties.Name: SetReaded
Properties.Caption: MarkAsRead
Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, all unread messages received will be marked as read

Properties.Name: Result
Properties.Caption: Result
Properties.Tooltip: [List] Returns a list of MailItem objects, each of which is an email with data. Numbering starts from zero. Example of available properties: Body - email simple text; HTMLBody - email text in HTML format; Sender.Address - sender's email address; Sender.Name - sender's name (if any); Subject - email subject. For example, we receive an email of the first message sender: $Result[0].Sender.Address

Properties.Tooltip: [List] List, in which you want to check for the sought element

Properties.Name: Item
Properties.Caption: Element
Properties.Tooltip: [Text/Number] Element, for which you want to check

Properties.Name: WholeWord
Properties.Caption: MatchWholeWordOnly
Properties.Tooltip: Word boundaries will be taken into account at search. For example: if the option is enabled, "Value" word will be found in "This Value" text, however will not be found in "This ValueTest" text.  If the option is disabled, "Value" word will be found in both cases.

Properties.Name: CheckType
Properties.Caption: CheckType
Properties.Tooltip: Select the type of check. Possible settings: "Include" - value must be in the list; "Exclude" - value must not be in the list

Properties.Name: ReverseCheck
Properties.Caption: ReverseCheck
Properties.Tooltip: When checking, swap the input values. When the property is enabled, the values from the list in the preset "Element" property will be checked for

Properties.Name: UseWildcard
Properties.Caption: ExtendedCheck
Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, a check with metacharacters (Wildcard) will be performed. For example: "test*", "te?t". If disabled, the check will be performed in a quick and easy way

Properties.Name: CaseSensitive
Properties.Caption: CaseSensitive
Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, character case will be taken into account at check, otherwise, it will be ignored

Properties.Name: FoundItem
Properties.Caption: Element
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Full value of the found element

Properties.Name: FoundIndex
Properties.Caption: Index
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Index of the found element. Numbering starts from zero

Properties.Name: ErrorLevel
Properties.Caption: HandlingMode
Properties.Tooltip: Select error-handling mode. Possible settings: "Default" - by default; "Ignore" - ignore errors; "Handle" - handle errors. If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

Properties.Name: ErrorDirection
Properties.Caption: OutputDirection
Properties.Tooltip: Select a block output direction in case of a failure. Possible settings: "Default" - by default; "Right" - to the right; "Bottom" - to the bottom. With this option, it is possible to determine output direction for blocks with no "If Error" connector (for example, "Condition" block) in case of an error. If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

Properties.Name: ReportLevel
Properties.Caption: MessageLevel
Properties.Tooltip: Select the level of messages to output blocks during operation. Possible settings: "Default" - by default; "Release" - deactivated output; "Debug" - main information output; "Detailed" - detailed information output. If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

Properties.Name: ErrorMessage
Properties.Caption: ErrorText
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Display detailed error information in case of a block failure

ItemsSettings.FriendlyName: Search a Hashtable and determine whether a pair with the specified key is available in the Hashtable

Properties.Name: Items
Properties.Caption: Hashtable
Properties.Tooltip: [Hashtable] Hashtable, in which you want to check for a pair with the specified key

Properties.Name: Key
Properties.Caption: Key
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Key to be checked in the Hashtable for

Properties.Name: WholeWord
Properties.Caption: MatchWholeWords
Properties.Tooltip: Word boundaries will be taken into account at search. For example: if the option is enabled, "Value" word will be found in "This Value" text, however will not be found in "This ValueTest" text.  If the option is disabled, "Value" word will be found in both cases.

Properties.Name: CheckType
Properties.Caption: CheckType
Properties.Tooltip: Select the type of check. Possible settings: "Include" - value must be in the Hashtable; "Exclude" - value must not be in the Hashtable

Properties.Name: ReverseCheck
Properties.Caption: ReverseCheck
Properties.Tooltip: When checking, swap the input values. When the property is enabled, the values from the Hashtable in the preset "Key" property will be checked for

Properties.Name: UseWildcard
Properties.Caption: ExtendedCheck
Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, a check with metacharacters (Wildcard) will be performed. For example: "test*", "te?t". If disabled, the check will be performed in a quick and easy way

Properties.Name: CaseSensitive
Properties.Caption: CaseSensitive
Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, character case will be taken into account at check, otherwise, it will be ignored

Properties.Name: FoundKey
Properties.Caption: Key
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Full text of the found key

Properties.Name: FoundValue
Properties.Caption: Value
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Full text of the found element

Properties.Name: Col
Properties.Caption: Column

Properties.Caption: WholeWord
Properties.Tooltip: When searching, word boundaries will be taken into account. For example: with the property enabled, the value "Value" will be found in the text "This Value", but will not be found in the text "This ValueTest". If the property is turned off, then the value "Value" will be found in both examples.

Properties.Name: CheckType
Properties.Caption: CheckType
Properties.Tooltip: Select the type of check. Possible values: "Include" - the value must be present in the table; "Exclude" - the value must not be contained in the table

Properties.Name: ReverseCheck
Properties.Caption: ReverseCheck
Properties.Tooltip: When checking, swap the input values. When the property is enabled, the presence of values from the table in the specified property "Value" will be checked

Properties.Name: UseWildcard
Properties.Caption: UseWildcard
Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, validation using metacharacters (Wildcard) will be used. For example: "test*", "te?t". If the property is disabled, then the check will be carried out in a simple way and will be faster

Properties.Name: CaseSensitive

Properties.Tooltip: If the property is enabled, then the check will take into account the case of characters, otherwise it will be ignored

If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

Properties.Name: Port

Properties.Name: Login
Properties.Caption: Username
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Login required for authorization on the server

Properties.Name: Password
Properties.Caption: Password
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Password required for authorization on the server

Properties.Name: Timeout
Properties.Caption: WaitTime
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Server response waiting time. The value is specified in milliseconds

Properties.Name: UseSSL
Properties.Caption: SSL
Properties.Tooltip: Specifies whether to use a secure connection

Properties.Name: TopCount
Properties.Caption: NumberOfEmails
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Number of recent emails to be received from the server

Properties.Name: DeleteAfter
Properties.Caption: DeleteAfterReceiving
Properties.Tooltip: Delete emails from the mail server after receiving them

Properties.Name: SetAsRead
Properties.Caption: MarkAsRead
Properties.Tooltip: Mark emails as read after receiving

Properties.Name: OnlyUnread
Properties.Caption: NewOnly
Properties.Tooltip: Receive only new emails

Properties.Name: OrderDate
Properties.Caption: SortDate
Properties.Tooltip: Sort type by date. Possible options: NewestFirst - new messages will be the first in the list; OldestFirst - old messages will be the first in the list

Properties.Name: FilterSubject
Properties.Caption: FilterSubject
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Message header filter. The filter format depends on the "Mail Header Filter Type" property

Properties.Name: FilterSubjectType
Properties.Caption: FilterSubjectType
Properties.Tooltip: Email header filter type. Possible values: Contains - simple check for text content (this check takes place on the server and is the fastest); Wildcard - use of metacharacters (*, ?); Regex - use of regular expressions. Wildcard and Regex filters are executed after receiving emails and are the most resource intensive. It is recommended to use them only with the "Only new" property set.

Properties.Name: MailFolder
Properties.Caption: Folder
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Folder on the mail server for receiving mail. If the value is empty, the Inbox folder will be used

[Text] Recognized text can be automatically divided into sections separated by commas. Separation method:
0 - Use the specified block separator
1 - Automatic division (Yandex only)
2 - Split on empty intervals longer than the specified number of characters

Properties.Name: OCRTextInsertSymbol

Properties.Name: OCRTextCountSymbols

Properties.Name: OCRTextScale
Properties.Caption: TextZoom
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Value indicating how many times the image should be enlarged before recognition. Depending on the engine used, magnifying the image by 2x or 3x helps to improve recognition quality.

Properties.Name: InString
Properties.Caption: Text
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Input string

Properties.Name: SubString
Properties.Caption: SubString
Properties.Tooltip: [Text/List] Searched substring or list of substrings. You can set an array with @("text1","mes")

Properties.Name: StartIndex
Properties.Caption: StartIndex
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Starting position of the search. Numbering starts from 0.

Properties.Name: WholeWord
Properties.Caption: WholeWord
Properties.Tooltip: When searching, word boundaries will be taken into account. For example: with the property enabled, the value "Value" will be found in the text "This Value", but will not be found in the text "This ValueTest". If the property is turned off, then the value "Value" will be found in both examples.

Properties.Name: CheckType
Properties.Caption: CheckType
Properties.Tooltip: Select the type of check. Possible values: "Include" - all specified substrings must be present in the string; "Exclude" - all specified substrings must not be contained in the string; "IncludeOne" - if at least one substring is found in the text, then the check is successful; "ExcludeOne" - if at least one substring is missing in the text, then the check is successful

Properties.Name: ReverseCheck
Properties.Caption: ReverseCheck
Properties.Tooltip: When checking, swap the input values "Text" and "Substring"

Properties.Name: UseWildcard
Properties.Caption: UseWildcard
Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, validation using metacharacters (Wildcard) will be used. For example: "test*", "te?t". If the property is disabled, then the check will be carried out in a simple way and will be faster

Properties.Name: CaseSensitive
Properties.Caption: CaseSensitive
Properties.Tooltip: If the property is enabled, then the check will take into account the case of characters, otherwise it will be ignored

Properties.Name: FindIndex
Properties.Caption: FindIndex
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the value of the specified string

Properties.Name: FindString
Properties.Caption: FindString
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] The value of the found substring is returned

Properties.Name: ErrorDirection
Properties.Caption: OutputDirection

If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

Properties.Name: ConnectorType
Properties.Caption: ConnectorType
Properties.Tooltip: Select the type of connection. Possible options: Server - connection to the server without launching the application, Application - launching a thick client, ApplicationHidden - launching a thick client, the window of which will be hidden. To work in Server mode, you must register the V83.COMConnector object (to do this, run the "regsvr32 comcntr.dll" command). To work in the Application and ApplicationHidden modes, you must register the "V83.Application" object (for this, the "1cv8.exe /regserver" command is run)

SherpaВозврат - this variable is used to retrieve the value after code execution and the name should not change

Properties.Tooltip: [Instance] Variable where a process ID is stored in. Defines an application to operate with. If the application window is minimized or overlapped with other windows, it will be on top. In case of operation in browsers, process ID additionally indicates a certain tab where a block shall operate. When blank or process ID variable is not assigned before the application start or a browser opening, the application and tab will be defined based on the content of corresponding selector string. Process ID may be retrieved, for example, by means of blocks Start Application or Get Process.

ItemsSettings.FriendlyName: Disconnect from the current RDP session from the remote computer's side and safely continue interaction with UI of remote session. In this case, the current session will be redirected to the console. Purpose of the block: when UI interactions are used, such as the operation of the mouse, keyboard (for example, controlling the Google Chrome browser), closing the remote connection window will result in an error in which the active session is lost and the control elements stop working. In other words, when the RDP remote connection window is closed, the user is disconnected and mouse and keyboard control becomes impossible. When using the block, the active session is redirected to the console. At the same time, the screen resolution is preserved and the controls remain available. The RDP connection window itself will be closed. This can also be done with the Shift+F4 key combinations after starting the robot, and you can change the combination in the robot settings.

ItemsSettings.FriendlyName: The block allows you to upload a file to a remote computer or download a file

Properties.Name: ProcessID
Properties.Caption: ProcessID
Properties.Tooltip: [Instance] A variable that stores the process ID. Specifies which application to work with. If the specified application is minimized or its window is covered by other windows, it will be brought to the foreground. When working with browsers, the process ID additionally indicates the specific browser tab that the block should work with. If the property is left blank, or if the process ID variable was not previously set when the application was launched or the browser was opened, the application and browser tab will be determined from the contents of the corresponding selector string. The process ID can be obtained, for example, using the Run application or Get process blocks.

Properties.Name: RemoteFile
Properties.Caption: RemoteFile
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Full path of the file on the remote computer

Properties.Name: LocalFile
Properties.Caption: LocalFile
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Full path of the file on the local computer

Properties.Name: OperationType
Properties.Caption: OperationType
Properties.Tooltip: The operation being performed. Possible values: Upload - uploading a local file along the path of a remote file (uploading a local file); Download - downloading a remote file along the path of a local file (downloading a remote file)

Properties.Name: Timeout
Properties.Caption: WaitTime
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Waiting time for the operation to complete. If the value is zero, then the property is ignored and the block will wait until the operation completes.

Properties.Name: ProcessID
Properties.Caption: ProcessID
Properties.Tooltip: [Instance] A variable that stores the process ID. Specifies which application to work with. If the specified application is minimized or its window is covered by other windows, it will be brought to the foreground. When working with browsers, the process ID additionally indicates the specific browser tab that the block should work with. If the property is left blank, or if the process ID variable was not previously set when the application was launched or the browser was opened, the application and browser tab will be determined from the contents of the corresponding selector string. The process ID can be obtained, for example, using the Run application or Get process blocks.

Properties.Tooltip: [Text] The name and path to the image file to be processed. Supported formats: .jpg; .png; .bmp; .gif; .tiff

Properties.Name: FileNameOut
Properties.Caption: DestinationImage
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] The name and path to the file to save the processed image. If the value is empty, it will use the same file that is specified in the "Input Image" property. Supported formats: .jpg; .png; .bmp; .gif; .tiff

Properties.Name: NewWidth
Properties.Caption: Width
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] The new width of the image. If the value is not specified or is zero, then when the "Proportional" property is enabled, the width of the image will change in proportion to the height. Otherwise, the width of the image will remain the same

Properties.Name: NewHeight
Properties.Caption: Height
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] The new height of the image. If the value is not specified or is equal to zero, then when the "Proportional" property is enabled, the height of the image will change in proportion to the width. Otherwise, the height of the image will remain the same

Properties.Name: NewPercent
Properties.Caption: Percent
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] The percentage by which the image will be enlarged. Can be a negative number

Properties.Name: NewDPI
Properties.Caption: Resolution (DPI)
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] New image resolution (DPI)

Properties.Name: IsProportionally
Properties.Caption: Proportionally
Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, the image will change proportionally. For the property to work, you can specify either the width or the height of the image

Properties.Name: IsStretch
Properties.Caption: Stretch
Properties.Tooltip: When enabled, the image will stretch to the new size

Properties.Name: Result
Properties.Caption: Result
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Name and path to the processed image file

Properties.Name: ErrorLevel
Properties.Caption: HandlingMode
Properties.Tooltip: Select error-handling mode. Possible settings: "Default" - by default; "Ignore" - ignore errors; "Handle" - handle errors. If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

Properties.Name: ReportLevel
Properties.Caption: MessageLevel
Properties.Tooltip: Select the level of messages to output blocks during operation. Possible settings: "Default" - by default; "Release" - deactivated output; "Debug" - main information output; "Detailed" - detailed information output. If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

Properties.Name: ErrorMessage
Properties.Caption: ErrorText
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Display detailed error information in case of a block failure

ItemsSettings.FriendlyName: Crop the image to the specified rectangle or crop the percentage of the image from the specified sides

Properties.Name: NewLeft
Properties.Caption: X / Left
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Specifies the X coordinate for cropping the image or the percentage to be cropped on the left

Properties.Name: NewTop
Properties.Caption: Y / Top
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Specifies the Y coordinate for cropping the image or the percentage that needs to be cropped from the top

Properties.Name: NewWidth
Properties.Caption: Width / Right
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Specifies the width to crop the image or the percentage to be cropped on the right

Properties.Name: NewHeight
Properties.Caption: Height / Bottom
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Specifies the height for cropping the image or the percentage that needs to be cropped from the bottom

Properties.Name: IsPercentage
Properties.Caption: AsPercentage
Properties.Tooltip: If enabled, the image will be cropped according to the specified percentages

Properties.Name: Result

Properties.Name: NewQuality

Properties.Name: MaxFileLength

For example: $TMessage.IsPhoto - if equal to $true, a photo is attached to the message

Properties.Name: IsCallback
Properties.Caption: Callback
Properties.Tooltip: [Boolean] If enabled, the message contains data about the callback (button click). Properties.Tooltip: [Hashtable] Hashtable of buttons that will be sent with the message. The key of the Hashtable is the name of the button, and the value of the Hashtable is the callback data. For example: @{ "Back"="butBack"; "Forward"="butForward" }. The values "butBack" and "butForward" will be returned in the $TMessage.CallbackData property. For more details, see the "Callback" property of the "Bot. Get message" block.

Properties.Name: Filter
Properties.Caption: Filter
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] String to filter the list of chats. Search this set value occurrence in chats (Id, Title) and dialogues (Id, FirstName, LastName, Username, Phone)

Properties.Name: Chats
Properties.Caption: ListOfChats
Properties.Tooltip: [Hashtable] List of chats retrieved in the form of a Hashtable. Hashtable keys are chat name, values are chat ID. For example: $chatid = $Chats["username"]. Retrieve chat ID value by username, then use this variable in message sending blocks

Properties.Name: ErrorLevel
Properties.Caption: HandlingMode
Properties.Tooltip: Select error-handling mode. Possible settings: "Default" - by default; "Ignore" - ignore errors; "Handle" - handle errors. If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

Properties.Name: ReportLevel
Properties.Caption: MessageLevel
Properties.Tooltip: Select the level of messages to output blocks during operation. Possible settings: "Default" - by default; "Release" - deactivated output; "Debug" - main information output; "Detailed" - detailed information output. If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

ItemsSettings.FriendlyName: Download messages from a chat. Messages are downloaded starting from the last one, i.e. from the bottom upwards

Properties.Name: TConnection
Properties.Caption: Connection
Properties.Tooltip: [Instance] Client connection object. This attribute variable name shall match with "Connection" attribute variable name of "Client. Make Connection" block from Telegram group used previously for Telegram client connection

Properties.Name: Target
Properties.Caption: Destination
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Destination object. Possible values of the string: chat ID, chat name, user ID, combination of user "FirstName LastName", Username value, user telephone number

Properties.Name: OffsetId
Properties.Caption: Replacement
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Message identifier to start download with. Default value is 0. It means that messages will be downloaded starting from the last one

Properties.Name: Limit
Properties.Caption: Quantity
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Set the limit number of messages being downloaded at a time

Properties.Name: FilterContact
Properties.Caption: ContactFilter
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] String to filter contacts in a chat. Search set value occurrence in Id, FirstName, LastName, Username, Phone

Properties.Name: FilterText
Properties.Caption: Message Filter
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] String to filter a message text. Search set value occurrence

Properties.Name: Messages
Properties.Caption: Messages
Properties.Tooltip: [List] Retrieve a list of messages. Each element of a list is a message object. Available settings of an object: Id - message ID; Date - date; From - message sender; To - message recipient; FromId - message sender ID; Title - chat name;  Text - message text; Type - message type in wording; IsFile - specifies whether a file is attached to the message (with this option a type can be detailed: IsDocument, IsPhoto). For example: $TMessage.IsPhoto - if equal to $true, a photo is attached to the message

ItemsSettings.FriendlyName: Perform anomaly detection based on a trained machine learning model

Properties.Name: FileModel

Properties.Name: Table
Properties.Caption: Data

Properties.Name: ColumnResult
Properties.Caption: ColumnResult
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] The name of the column for recording the result. If the column is not in the data received at the input of the block, then it will be added. For example: "Score"

Properties.Name: Result

Properties.Tooltip: [DataTable] Prediction result

ItemsSettings.FriendlyName: This block allows you to send requests to classic Open AI generative models up to ChatGPT. With its help you can create new texts on demand, perform various tasks of classification, summarization, translation and rewriting of texts, writing code prototypes in different programming languages, parse semi-structured and unstructured data, extract and process facts, maintain a dialogue on a variety of topics, and much more. Payment for the use of this functionality is debited from the client's personal account on the platform. For test purposes, each new user is given the opportunity to test this functionality without payment. When using this functionality, payment is required after moving the robot into the production.

Properties.Name: Prompt
Properties.Caption: Prompt
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Enter natural language request

Properties.Name: Model
Properties.Caption: Model
Properties.Tooltip: Select the model to generate the text with. The "text-davinci-003" model offers the highest generation quality, but its use is the most expensive and slow. Other models may offer cheaper and faster results, due to some loss of generation quality. By trial and error, choose the model that is best suited to solve your problems.

Properties.Name: Stop
Properties.Caption: Stop
Properties.Tooltip: [Test/List] Text or list of up to 4 strings which will stop generation should if the model outputs such text. The returned text will not contain these words

Properties.Name: Temperature
Properties.Caption: Temperature
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] A decimal fractional number from 0 to 1 indicating the degree of "randomness" or "creativity" of the result, where 0 is the least creative result, and 1 is the most random result. For most creative tasks, the value 0.7 is better suited, and if you want to get the same answer to the same request every time, set the value to 0.

Properties.Name: MaxLength
Properties.Caption: MaxLength
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] The maximum length of the result, expressed in conditional tokens. For English, 1 token is 4 characters, for most other languages, 1 token is 1 character. Decrease this number if you want to receive shorter queries on average, increase it to receive longer queries. Note that this number limits the length of the response, but the response you receive will not necessarily be the length you specified - depending on the content of the request, it may be shorter.

Properties.Name: AutoLengthLimit
Properties.Caption: AutoLengthLimit
Properties.Tooltip: When enabled, the specified maximum length will be automatically adjusted. To do this, the number of tokens in the request is calculated and the maximum possible number of tokens for the selected model is taken into account

Properties.Name: Timeout
Properties.Caption: Timeout
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Maximum response waiting time in seconds. The actual waiting time depends on the selected model, the length of your request and the predicted response length, as well as the current server load. In case of timeout an error occures.

Properties.Name: Response
Properties.Caption: Response
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Response of generative model

Properties.Name: TotalTokens
Properties.Caption: TotalLength
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] The total length of the request and result (combined together), expressed in tokens

Properties.Name: ErrorLevel
Properties.Caption: HandlingMode
Properties.Tooltip: Select error-handling mode. Possible settings: "Default" - by default; "Ignore" - ignore errors; "Handle" - handle errors. If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

Properties.Name: ReportLevel
Properties.Caption: MessageLevel
Properties.Tooltip: Select the level of messages to output blocks during operation. Possible settings: "Default" - by default; "Release" - deactivated output; "Debug" - main information output; "Detailed" - detailed information output. If "Default" is selected, a value of "Start" block of the diagram will be used.

ItemsSettings.FriendlyName: This block allows you to send requests to new Open AI generative models starting with ChatGPT. With its help you can create new texts on demand, perform various tasks of classification, summarization, translation and rewriting of texts, writing code prototypes in different programming languages, parse semi-structured and unstructured data, extract and process facts, maintain a dialogue on a variety of topics, and much more. Payment for the use of this functionality is debited from the client's personal account on the platform. For test purposes, each new user is given the opportunity to test this functionality without payment. When using this functionality, payment is required after moving the robot into the production.

Properties.Name: InTable
Properties.Caption: ChatHistory
Properties.Tooltip: [DataTable] Add the chat history, based on the context of which the neural network should generate a response. The specified data table must contain columns named "Role" and "Content". In the absence of such columns, the first column of the table will be used as "Role", and the second column will be used as "Content". In the "Role" column, you can specify only one of the following values: system, assistant and user. The system role is designed to adjust the tonality and basic settings of the neural network, for example, with the "system" role, you can write "You are a helpful assistant on used cars selection. You know everything on how to choose the best deal for used car". With the "assistant" role, it is recommended to include previous messages generated by the neural network itself. With the "user" role, it is recommended to include replicas written by the user-interlocutor. Older messages should be placed at the beginning of the table, newer ones at the end of the table. The "Content" column should contain the message itself. This property can be left empty, then generation will be performed only on the contents of the "Role" and "Request" properties.

Properties.Name: ContentSystem
Properties.Caption: SystemContent
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Enter the text of a new request to the neural network. The request will be executed with the system role

Properties.Name: Content
Properties.Caption: UserContent
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Enter the text of a new request to the neural network. The request will be executed with the user role

ItemsSettings.FriendlyName: The block allows you to get embedding by line or list of lines using the Open AI service. Embedding is a vector (set of numbers) that characterize the meaning associated with the transmitted input text. Words or sentences with a close meaning will have embedding and with a minimum cosine distance. Embeddings can also be used to search for words, lines, or paragraphs that are closest in meaning in document databases.

Properties.Name: InputData
Properties.Caption: Input
Properties.Tooltip: [Text/List] Input text or a list of texts for which embeddings will be calculated. If a list of texts is passed to the input, the output will also have a list of embeddings for each of the elements of the input text. The maximum allowed length of each line is 8192 tokens.

Properties.Name: Model
Properties.Caption: Model
Properties.Tooltip: Select the model to generate the response

Properties.Name: AsDataTable
Properties.Caption: AsDataTable
Properties.Tooltip: When enabled, the result will be returned as a data table with two columns: "Text" and "Embeddings"

Properties.Name: Timeout
Properties.Caption: Timeout
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] Maximum response waiting time in seconds.

Properties.Name: Embeddings
Properties.Caption: Embeddings
Properties.Tooltip: [Text/List/DataTable] If one row was passed to the input, then the output is a vector representation of the embedding in JSON format (an array of numbers). If a list of strings was passed to the input, then the output will be a list of embeddings in JSON format (an array of numbers). If the "As a data table" property is enabled, the output will be a data table with two columns: "Text" and "Embeddings"

ItemsSettings.FriendlyName: The block allows for a given embedding query to find the most similar rows in the knowledge base, which is a table of objects and their embeddings, and return the indexes of these rows in the form of a list sorted in descending order of similarity. Embeddings for both the query and the embeddings table for which the search is performed can be obtained using the Get Embeddings block.

Properties.Name: QueryEmbedding
Properties.Caption: EmbeddingRequest
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Embedding, for which you need to find similar rows in the table. The value for this field can be obtained using the Get Embedding block.

Properties.Name: TableBase
Properties.Caption: KnowledgeBase
Properties.Tooltip: [DataTable] The table to be searched for. One of the columns of the table must contain embedding, the other columns of the table can contain any user data.

Properties.Name: ColEmbeddings
Properties.Caption: EmbeddingsColumn
Properties.Tooltip: [Number/Text] The index or the name of the column from the table specified in the "Knowledge Base" property in which the embeddings are placed. By default, 1.

Properties.Name: CountResult
Properties.Caption: NumberResults
Properties.Tooltip: [Number] The maximum number of rows returned by the block is the results from the knowledge base. By default, 5.

Properties.Name: ListIndexes
Properties.Caption: ListIndexes
Properties.Tooltip: [List] A list of indexes of rows from the Knowledge Base containing the most similar to the embedding query, sorted in descending order of similarity.

Properties.Name: ListSimilarity
Properties.Caption: ListSimilarity
Properties.Tooltip: [List] Numerical similarity measures for each of the results

ItemsSettings.FriendlyName: Perform Named Entities Recognition (NER) for a given text

Properties.Name: InText
Properties.Caption: SourceText
Properties.Tooltip: [Text] Source text for processing

Properties.Name: Result
Properties.Caption: Result
Properties.Tooltip: [ListOfObjects] Returns a list of objects. The numbering starts from zero. Each object contains three properties: Type - entity type in English abbreviation; Text - full text of the found entity; Items - a list of child objects of this entity. For example: to get the type of the first found entity, you need to write $Result[0].Type. Child objects have the same properties and allow you to decipher the parent entity in more detail. For example, the PERSON entity contains child entities SEX, LASTNAME, FIRSTNAME, BORN
